meanings.definition: To divide or separate into parts
meanings.sent1: She comparted the cake into slices for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: The teacher comparted the class into groups for the group project.
meanings.sent3: The magician comparted the scarf into multiple pieces, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The river comparted the land, creating a natural divide between the two regions.
meanings.sent5: The chef comparted the ingredients meticulously before starting the recipe.

meanings.definition: To compare or contrast two or more things
meanings.sent1: He comparted the two laptops to decide which one to buy.
meanings.sent2: The article comparted the benefits of exercise versus a sedentary lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The siblings always comparted their favorite toys to see who had the better ones.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork comparted light and dark shades to create a striking contrast.
meanings.sent5: The student comparted the different study methods to find the most effective one.

meanings.definition: To share or distribute something among different people or groups
meanings.sent1: The charity organization comparted food to families in need during the holidays.
meanings.sent2: The manager comparted the bonuses among the employees based on their performance.
meanings.sent3: The team captain comparted the snacks equally among the players.
meanings.sent4: The queen comparted her wealth generously among her subjects.
meanings.sent5: The teacher comparted the prizes to the top three students in the competition.
